intro: Didymocheton hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan tamarind tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to southern China, particularly Hainan Island. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces elongated, woody pods that contain edible seeds, which are often used in traditional Chinese cuisine. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
